skillname: Donnie Keller - Fort Worth Real Estate
title: He will do the heavy lifting
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2019
content: I was referred to Donnie by a friend John Unsworth. He had a rental property that was giving him issues and told me Donnie got him top dollar and did it fast. I was having person issues in a relationship I was in and figured it would be easier to sell the house than go through a eviction process. My property had a nice home on a terrible lot. Donnie met with me went over a detailed plan to get top dollar for my house quickly. He told me what I needed to do to get my house ready for sale and how he was going to market it. I had my end of the bargain done in a week. He listed my home and had a open house that first weekend and had ‚Äúglamor shots‚Äù of my house done. I cannot over emphasis how bad my lot was. Zero lot lines and a two level backyard. This was a challenge. Donnie had my house sold within 3 weeks and got why I felt was top of the mark considering the poor lot. I highly recommend him. He is not a realtor to list your house on MLS and wait for a offer he is proactive, professional and has a plan. Highly recommend.Rob Bailes

content: I will have to update this review because I only listened to this once but had the web page opened and had to tell you about this skill.  I enabled and disabled about 10 space news skills before finding this one.  It really had news not just headlines and stuff I didn't know.  I really wanted to know what companies and government's were doing in space.  I really wanted to know about the race to the Moon and who was doing what.  This skill was obviously written by a paeson and did not just give a teaser with no information.  It told about China landing on the dark side of the moon but didn't stop there.  It listed the instruments which us techs know what could be done and also gave the non-techs objectives in the biological world like the probe took seeds to plant to see if we can grow things with lunar soil.  It said more in a very quick space of time which is harder than you would think.  I actually wish it went further in deapth but realice that this is a flash breafing.  Giving this criteria I wish it told me where to go (Podcast or web) to ge more info.  I hope that this brief doesn't say this same things every day (not updated) which I have run into but if it changes every few days I will be satisfied.  I can always say, "Next" to skip to my newt flash briefing.

title: Makes Computer Generated Voice Sound Real
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 1, 2019
content: SSML is a markup language providing enough tools to make voice from text sound real. Yet, memorizing and coding all the tags is typically very time consuming. This editor makes it much easier. I was able to start and finish converting my six paragraph project from text to perfect speech on the day I first learned SSML existed. The editor can make Alexa speak the result, or the finished markup text can be pasted into any SSML player, such as Amazon Polly.

title: Look no further for your realtor. It's Mike!
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2019
content: We were referred to Mike Hrezo by a realtor in another community. It proved to be an excellent referral.  Not only is he extremely skilled, knowledgeable and personable, but he truly cares about delivering all-around service excellence.Because of him, the transaction was smooth, speedy and effortless.In fact, we were so impressed that we sought Mike's assistance to complete another real estate transaction several years later. Though we were expecting great things, he still managed to wow us.  You may be sure that, should we ever have the opportunity to do another real estate transaction in the Santa Clarita area, Mike will be our first and only call.

title: Very knowledgeable about real estate in the Valencia area.
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2019
content: When my wife and I decided to move to a single story home in the Valencia Mike Hrezo came to our aide.  We met with him and told him what we were looking for in a home.  We were not expecting to find a house meeting our requirements in a short time but within a month Mike found the exact house.  He worked with the seller to negotiate the price, the purchase of some of the fixtures, paintings and yard furniture.  He then moved forward with the purchase with very little work required by us.  He was very professional and knowledgeable of the process.  It was very painless for us.  I would recommend using Mike to anyone selling or buying a house.

title: He Made the Difference
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2019
content: When we made the exciting--yet intimidating--decision to buy a house, we admittedly went with a realtor who didn't really understand us or what we were looking for. We knew we needed to make a change, especially when we started looking in the Valencia area. Mike Hrezo was that change. Scratch that. He was a relief. He instantly understood not only what we were looking for as far as location and budget, but he understood US. Our personalities, our preferences, our dreams. He was upbeat and very professional during the entire process and when we thought we had found our dream home (and then lost it), Mike didn't let us down. He found our real home, the home we live in now, and was a teammate throughout it all.Looking for a home can be very frustrating, sometimes even heartbreaking, but Mike became a true friend in the process, keeping our best interests at the top. If you're looking for a home in the Santa Clarita Valley, Mike Hrezo is your guy.

title: Disappointing experience
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2020
content: My ex chose Mike to help us sell our home. He showed it frequently, and eventually found a buyer. However, he seemed to change his approach when he realized that I chose a separate realtor to help me with my home purchase. From the signed purchase agreement, til closing, he was not communicating in ways that represented the best interests of both of us.  He created and ‚Äúagreement‚Äù between my ex and the buyer for her to ‚Äúrent‚Äù the property for a few weeks after closing. He did not communicate this with me or the escrow company, and presumed that I would be willing to pay the ‚Äúrent‚Äù of my ex. Instead of attempting to resolve the admitted mistake, he pointed fingers of blame at the escrow company and myself.  He was slow to respond to questions able repairs and closing specifics, but was quick to relay text messages from my ex, that had nothing to do with the sale of the house.  When I told him to NOT respond or relay these type of messages, he refused.  I was very disappointed in his change after finding out I chose someone else for my purchase.#pettiness

title: Amazing Agent!!!
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2019
content: My husband and I didn't know much about the Valencia area when we were looking to buy here. We quickly learned that we luckily fell into the best hands. Mike was so knowledgeable about every single area of Santa Clarita and was able to educate and guide us every step of the way. He was always available to us, spending as much time as needed to answer any questions and to help with any hiccups along the way. In addition to finding us our new home, he also sold our home at the time, and managed any hiccups that happened with patience, confidence, and professionalism. Not only is he invaluable as far as his connections and experience go, but his commitment and dedication to finding the perfect house for us was apparent. Even other things that first-time homebuyers might not know, Mike was there to help with, as far as excellent referrals for repairs or remodels, or questions as to where any 'valve thingy' might be located in the house. Based on sales orders, existing POs, and forecast based on prior period, I recommend PO order for quantity of 1000.  Would you like me to create a purchase order for that quantity with preferred vendor.Yes, create PO.Alexa then creates the purchase order.Since Alexa is now available within prescription glass frames (Alexa Frames), this would allow staff hands-free capability while walking around a warehouse, mfg shop floor, or even while walking outside on a construction job site.This same concept could be extended to manufacturing operations steps to record labor and raw materials in the manufacturing process without having to key into a laptop or enter in the mobile app.

title: don't confuse this with an Amazon product
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2019
content: This app allows users to connect to their synchrony account which is branded for Amazon. Amazon itself has absolutely nothing to do with the account or the card. But product is operated like any other mastercard or visa bank card, by the bank that issued it.The most annoying thing about is that it sends me an email almost every day telling me that I am within $50,000 of my credit limit. lol

title: Don't do it!!
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2020
content: It has been nothing but a nightmare!!I made regular payments like I do on all my cards. But for some reason synchrony bank would show my payment as processed. My bank even showed the payment went through. Then a couple weeks later payment was reversed and I suddenly have a late fee!!!This exact situation happened to me twice then I got an email informing me my account has been canceled!!!I had good credit when I started this card because I make my payments, other wise I wouldn't have been approved in the first place!!DO NOT DO IT!!Or you to will have a blemish on your credit like me.I love Amazon that's why I wanted this and I don't blame them it's this synchrony bank really screwed me over.

content: A disputed transaction/amount will become a nightmare for the consumer who had the misfortune of using the Amazon store card. Even with documented proof the disputed charge will sit there on your account,the bank will take 60 days to "investigate" and another 10 or more days to let you know about their "investigation". This card will not provide you with any real shopping benefits and Synchrony Bank should be given the 'worst customer service ever' award.Don't get this card or any card this bank is behind. You will regret it big time. As for Amazon it is turning into a really really bad shopping experience so it is only a matter of time till consumers turn to something else.  Can't wait!

Simply goto Amazon.com, scroll all the way to the bottom and choose the ‚ÄúAmazon.com Store Card‚Äù link. It‚Äôs listed Under ‚ÄúAmazon Payment Products‚Äù  (3rd Column from the Left, 2nd Item Down).Anyway hopefully that help curb the Skill Hate. Otherwise the Skill really was great when it was working. title: Make's life so much easier
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2019
content: Alexa works great in our main conference room.I hate the old way with our previous provider where you had to look up the phone number, enter the conference id, and then enter in the leader/moderator pin.  Alexa turns on the speaker phone and signs me in automatically.  No more waiting 5 minutes just to get logged in.  Their Comcast Business Companion App also makes this process much easier.Jeremy over at Comcast Business was also very helpful with the instructions he sent us and following up if we had any issues.  The instructions were clear and step-by-step that anyone can figure it out.  He asked for genuine feedback and ways they can make our life easier.  Look forward in seeing how Alexa and Comcast Business can evolve together.Comcast Business (BVE) has provided us with many useful ways to speed up and assist with calls.  It's so easy to work remotely due to power loss, bad weather, or any other incident.  We can keep track with Skype if people are working and on call.  We can call people from Skype.  We also have the ability to call via chrome, so when we google a number we can click and be on the phone.  This plus so much more.  Being the IT manager and rolling out new technology you generally get some push back when trying new things, but I have been fortunate enough that its so easy and people see the value right away.

title: Little differences for a much better work life
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2020
content: I have been using the Alexa control for Comcast BVE in our Conference Room and my office for the past few weeks and have found some excellent surprises in adding each to those locations.First was setting up the system; after trialing other Alexa Room Control solutions that forced me to spool up AWS services and never fully worked I was weary. I was very surprised at how easy they make getting the Alexa side of things connected, really a click of 2 buttons in the end.As a Pro A/V company our Conference Room serves the dual purpose of being a meeting space while also being a sales demonstration arena. The Alexa control is not only easy when starting a meeting to scheduling one but has caught the interest of many visitors to the room. I think as this continues to grow it will become a meeting room staple for most organizations.The larger surprise was using the Alexa service in my office... I have found little to be more satisfying then asking Alexa to turn on "Do Not Disturb" as I exit the office for the day. I realized it is the small ways it allows me to schedule and set my phone statuses as needed without having to punch in key codes or fumble through a menu.Overall I would highly recommend, if you have the option, taking the Comcast BVE Alexa Skill for a spin; I think you'll be pleasantly surprised by the small ways it makes life easier.

title: Hands-free updates from my advisor.
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2020
content: This voice app notifies me when Three Bell Capital has a voice update for me. When there is a market event or the team has news for me, a.k.a. the client, they share a short voice recording here. Pretty cool.I like how quick and easy it is to hear from my advisor this way instead of reading another email. Even my wife likes listening to them. She would never read their email updates.It's a simple skill, which is what I want for easy use.  I just tell it to play and I'm listening to the latest update from our firm's Managing Partner.  They have company info and employee bios, photos on the skill which is nice, but for me, it's not the timely info I'm seeking. Maybe if you want to know more about the firm and the employees. That's just not why I'm using the skill.Nice visuals on my Show, but also works with audio-only Alexa devices throughout my home, on my Alexa iPhone app, and in my car.All-in-all, pretty cool. Feel like my money and I are getting on the same page ;-)

content: I've moved A LOT. We're former military, so I've worked with a lot of agents. Faith is by far the BEST. Faith is KNOWLEDGEABLE--she knows this market and many people in Las Vegas very well. Faith is ALWAYS PREPARED--whenever we had meetings with her, she was on time and ready, having obviously taken the time to prep before each meeting. Faith is an ADVOCATE for her clients. She's not afraid to play hardball and willingly offers valuable advice when needed. She was almost like having a real estate lawyer on our side--she stood up for us during the entire process of selling our home. Faith is RESPONSIVE--any time we had a question or needed any help at all, she was there on the phone, through email, or in person. We never, not once felt like we were on our own for anything. Most of all, Faith is HONEST and FAIR and she will ensure that whomever you deal with on the opposite side of your transaction will be too.Honestly, this is your sign--whether you're buying or selling, you can't go wrong in choosing Faith Harmer as your real estate agent.

skillname: Faith Harmer - Las Vegas NV Real Estate
title: Outstanding Realtor!  We cannot say enough wonderful things about Faith & Team!
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2020
content: We were selling our parents' home in Las Vegas and we live out of town. Since the pandemic hit just after we went on the market, Faith and team took care of everything that we had intended to do when we returned to Las Vegas, including packing up some items we left behind and sending them to us, and coordinating and overseeing some projects for the house. They went above and beyond anything we could have ever expected!  Faith even sold our house twice, as the initial buyer fell out of escrow 2 days before closing, on a Friday afternoon.  The house went back on the market Saturday morning, Sunday was Mother's Day, and our house was back under escrow again by the close of business Monday!  Faith and her team do not miss a single detail and got the house sold quickly, despite the pandemic and riots!  We chose Faith after reading reviews, and the first time we met her we knew we were in good hands.  She and her team are very communicative and proactive.  We highly recommend Faith and Team!  They are completely honest, trustworthy and transparent about every step of the selling process.  Faith took the time to answer every question we had, which often involved 3 way conference calls between our family (siblings) living in separate states, and Faith and our parents' house in Las Vegas.  She is not only our Realtor of Choice, she and her team have become our friends!

title: Quarrel with appraisal?  Faith fights for you.
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2019
content: When my wife and I decided it was time to sell our home we were fortunate to find Faith Harmer.  We asked Faith to look at our home and suggest things we could or should do to best prepare the house to sell at a good price.Faith shared her thoughts and we  took her advice.  When we asked if she knew people who could be trusted to do good work for us at a reasonable price she graciously provided a list of people she had used in the past.  Their work confirmed that they were people who did good work at a fair price.When we felt the house was ready to be listed Faith arranged photographs and a video tour of the house.  Both were amazing.In a market that was growing tougher for sellers we received a full price offer about three weeks from the date we listed.  We closed less than thirty days later for the full asking price.Here is the amazing part of that:  The appraiser, hired by the buyer, appraised our home $20,000 lower than our asking price.  Faith believed that the appraisal was flawed and showed the buyer‚Äôs agent and appraiser how and why it was flawed.  The appraiser studied Faith‚Äôs argument and adjusted his appraisal up.  Amazing!  Faith knows her stuff.Faith is the kind of agent that you want on your side when you are ready to sell your home.  We were really fortunate to find her.

content: "Alexa, Ask TD Ameritrade..." is 10 syllables and cumbersome to say. Please shorten to "Ask TD" or "Ask Ameritrade". Having these two features would allow the user to ask once to get all the info they need rather than ask for every single quote which is incredibly tedious! Support for Scottrade account in addition to Ameritrade would be nice since you guys are merging.

title: Absolutely Useless
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2018
content: Spend 3 minutes with this skill and you will never go back. First, you must say, "Alexa, tell TD Ameritrade ..." Should just be TD OR Ameritrade. Next, I asked "Alexa, ask TD Ameritrade to give me an update." There isn't a way to link my TD Ameritrade and Alexa accounts so I wasn't looking for a personal update, just a market update. Alexa went into a 60 second reading from a webpage about how to update my TD Ameritrade password. Ask, "Alexa, ask TD Ameritrade for a MARKET update." She says, "You can get detailed information about the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow. Which index would you like to hear more about?" She could just as easily have given all 3 updates. The lights on the top of the Echo spin for 15 seconds before a question is answered. No other skill takes this long.

title: Not That Smart
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2017
content: OK so first I have to say Alexa Ameritrade then I have to listen to the things Amertitrade can do, then I try a stock if it to give me a quote (which is only some of the time) it gives you the quote and then returns to standby mode instead of asking would I like another; I have to start all over and say, Alexa; Ameritrade then I get a list of things she can do; Is this starting to sound familiar? This is a waste of time.

title: Great skill
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2021
content: I'm always getting my hands dirty, either in my workshop or the kitchen, so I've gotten very comfortable using Alexa for quick info on whatever.  I use TDA on Alexa to check my watchlist and gainers/losers every morning, but the biggest value is the ability to check my account balances, so I know when a deposit has hit and I have funds for trading.  I recently got an Alexa with a screen and was pleasantly surprised to see that this skill also shows data on the screen for all the features I have used for the past year or so. In the past I've tried Alexa's default quotes, my banks skill, and the CNBC skill for a variety of market/finance info, but they're all lacking compared to the TDA offering.

title: Live TV on your Echo Show - my favorite skill
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2017
content: This is by far my favorite skill on my Echo Show. You can use this skill to live stream Bloomberg TV channel, which is to my knowledge the only live-streaming video channel (news or otherwise) on Echo Show. And the video feed is rock solid steady and good quality (depending on your internet connection to be of course). No bugs or stream fails like sometimes happens with radio or in the flash briefing. In addition to be a good service to viewiers, it‚Äôs a model for others in the sector (both content providers like CNN, CNBC, etc., and service providers like the cable TV companies, cord cutting live streaming TV services like Hulu TV, AT&T DirecTV, etc.) who are racing to bring TV content to our phones, tablets and other screens to take note of.  My Echo Show sits on my desk all day and right now Bloomberg has a monopoly on live streaming TV news to this screen.

title: CryptoUpdater knows what "Monero" is... but Alexa doesn't
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2018
content: If you say "Alexa, ask CryptoUpdater for the latest price of monero", Alexa will interpret "monero" as "monroe" or "more narrow".  To get this to work, say "Alexa, open CryptoUpdater", then ask for price of monero.  This is likely a limitation of the Alexa service rather than the skill itself (I sent some feedback).  Apparently "Ethereum" has the same problem.

title: Use at your own risk
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 28, 2021
content: The skill is of very limited use without linking it with your Fidelity account.  When you do that, it will ask you to click that you agree.  I don't blame Fidelity in the least for what they tell you you'd be agreeing to, but once it's clear how much is out of Fidelity's control and in Amazon's control, you should think twice before agreeing.  I praise Fidelity for disclosing the risks in such detail. Unfortunately, many people click "I agree" without reading things and I don't know how many of them read reviews.  Just remember that once you agree, Fidelity no longer guarantees the security of your account.

title: Not Siri, not real-time, too chatty, spammy
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2016
content: The skill "Fidelity Investments" useless for me because it is not real-time. However, if you don't care about this or any of the other issues mentioned below, here is how to use the Fidelity app. 1. Enable Fidelity Investments skill 2. Here are some samples from "help" (but remember, the answers are not real-time): Alexa, Ask Fidelity to get a quote for Amazon Alexa, Ask Fidelity to get me the market update Alexa, Ask Fidelity how is Amazon doing today 3. I found I could just say "Alexa, ask Fidelity Apple" and I would get a quote - again, not real-time.There are numerous other problems besides the real-time issue with the Fidelity Investments app, I will list them all now: 1. not real-time 2. no pre-market, no after-market quote 3. too chatty -- after a quote, the app asks me what else I want to do giving me options -- this is annoying 4. app sometimes does not understand me when I ask the app to Stop - I'd like an app that lets me ask the quote and be done with it, as Siri does. With this app, I actually have to tell Alexa to stop. 5. Spammy. After I do successfully (phew!) stop the app, I hear a "Thank you for using Fidelity Investments". This is really annoying. I already know it's Fidelity because I have to "ask Fidelity".

title: Nope
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2016
content: Too wordy. All I want is how much the stock is up or down and what it is selling for. An example:AMAZON up 25 points to $625. That's all the info I want/need.Also you should have the ability to enter stock symbols from the app.6/3/2020 Update: just a side note. When I wrote this review in 2016 I put the actual price Amazon was selling for that day. $625! Today it closed at $2472! If only I had a crystal ball back then LOL.

title: Gets stuck on first stock, has zero value even when linked
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2021
content: Need to stop the still and ignore the prompt for 'what else can I help you with' to break the link to first stock quote. Otherwise every quote comes back the same, regardless of how you ask (i tried multiple ways). Any request about my portfolio, accounts or balances all returned "All 2 of your tax forms are available" plus needless info about tax form deadlines & other nonsense. If I'm going to link my f'g account to Alexa for goodness sake I expect to at least get my daily balance. Only good for getting market movers and high/low prices, which other apps do FAR better. Was hoping the 'Podcast' would make up for lack of features, but its a feed from 'Modern Life' about marriage & tackling hard conversations. NO THANKS. Will uninstall and I regret ever linking my accounts.

title: Expert bite-size insights about UX and product design
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2019
content: This is the best available briefing about product design. J Cornelius knows this field. This briefing is thoughtful, articulate, and actionable. It's similar to the Design Driven podcast from Nine Labs but is carefully created for the Flash Briefing format.A fantastic resource for anyone in UX or a product related field.J uses themes to chunk the content. For a few days in a row, he focuses on one subject such as Human Centered Business or how to effectively perform a Brand Check-In. This makes it effective from a learning standpoint - chunking is how our brains retain information. <3 minutes a day is a magic number for this. High quality content here.

title: Baller Skill for National Economic News Updates
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2019
content: This skill is way better than I anticipated. I'd encourage anyone looking for a baller national economic news update to download this, as I initially thought the flash news update would be more applicable to Atlanta and I live in Chicago. So I was pleasantly surprised that is gave updates on GDP, speeches by Federal Reserve Governors and Bank Presidents, wage growth, and BLS employment number updates, all of which apply to the national economic outlook. I suppose this is because every reserve bank has it's nitch in national work. I'd really love it if the Board of Governors or the other Reserve Banks came out with their own briefings, as Atlanta's seems to be a simple algorithm that probably only reads from their banks news updates, but is ever-so-helpful to the busy econ nerd on the go!

title: Spoken Narration of Wired Articles
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 4, 2017
content: This "flash briefing" skill opens with a 15 second ad (not a great start) but then jumps into a spoken edition of Wired. Spoken edition is a narrative reading of the articles on Wired's site.This mornings first article was a 1500 word piece on a relevant topic that is in the news and the narration lasted about 9 minutes. Then it launched the same ad, and started onto the next article on the site.Unfortunately because it's a flash briefing you can not skip from one article to the next, instead "Alexa, Next" moves you to the next part of your flash briefing (i.e. weather, etc.). No idea how long it'll keep going since I prefer my flashing briefing to be short headlines. It does however update daily.If you prefer longer form flash briefings though this is a great supplement to other in depth business podcasts.

title: YNAB rules but with Alexa (meh)
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2017
content: First let me say I absolutely love YNAB, no exaggeration it changed our family's life (with Dave Ramsey). But we integrate Alexa into our home to make certain tasks easier. YNAB on Alexa does not make YNAB tasks easier, I end up spending more time fixing what I did via Alexa than if I had just waited to enter transactions on the PC. The inquiries seem to work well (what's my balance in such and such category) but entering transactions feels cludgy and does not save me time. I'm probably going to disable the skill, but will to continue use YNAB on the web and iOS. Now if I could get reports and search on iOS, I could die happy!

title: Ineffectual... but Fun to Review
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2021
content: Read to the end, please.The lack of description misleads all except any who already know the business to think it has something to do with karaoke. Then there is the fact any who actually assume it IS a business or an app developer company's name may think there must be a mistake. Afterall, Tammy's Tingle sounds more like the Signature Service listing on a Las Vegas Call Girl's Collector Card.However, I had to download it just to find out if maybe it was a joke karaoke app in which call girls flirted with you and begged you to sing karaoke with them... or maybe a karaoke app with the backing tracks including the recordings of call girl tricks. Despite my lack of interest in the content, my curiosity is insatiable and I just had to know.Sadly, it is merely an app that answers questions about a seemingly real karaoke jockey's business. Talk about disappointing. The name was such a build-up. I feel let down. Just, wow... it's so sad, so very very sad.Luckily, most KJs get a following before anyone ever realizes their business' name. So, as an advertising ploy, admittedly, this will get the name in people's head. Maybe Tammy will be/ is already particularly popular at Bachelor, Bachelorette, and frat parties.

skillname: Jillian Zhorne - Little Elm Real Estate
title: Very Bad Choice
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2019
content: VERY poor experience. Provided poor customer service. Very slow to relay information. Suggested I see her realtor friend's overpriced house first, and upon seeing it, urged me to put in an offer on it ASAP as "it will go fast." It was a fix and flip with an already cracked "custom stone etched concrete patio." It sat for months and was reduced in price by 15% or so before selling. Consistently late for appointments, time after time. Urged me to use her financing person (Doug Turner at Brazos Bank) and was furious when I told her I was going with a different choice which offered a lower rate. A buyer side realtor should be looking out for my interests, while instead I think she was angry to miss out on potential illegal referral bonus from Doug. Urged me to use her inspector. When I informed her that I had found another one I preferred, she said "<---inspector name---> I don't know who the heck they are." Then reiterated I use her inspector and said I couldn't / shouldn't follow the inspector and ask questions. Suggested that her coworker/team leads husband (general contractor) fix a structural issue instead of going through required (for a structural issue no matter how small) permit process. After she quit my transaction, I did get the seller to agree to fix it, and ultimately required them to get a permit. Left me waiting nearly 24 hours before informing me that the seller signed my offer, and only did so after I texted her (for the third time) asking if she had heard anything. This cut into my 7 day option period.  Stated that she "hates working for the buyer" the second time I met her (should have been a red flag to walk away, but didnt realize it was so easy to walk away from a realtor).At any rate, whatever you do, DO NOT believe the 5 star reviews. She quit my transaction after the contract was signed. Then her lead insisted I still had to work with them. I raised heck with Fathom Realty and ultimately they released themselves from the contract as well. Thankfully I was able to get a realtor who was actually willing to work for me and we closed the sale with almost all of what I was requesting from the seller.Definitely STAY AWAY or you will have a nightmare experience like I did!

title: I don't like the political bent to some of the side comments she makes.
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2021
content: Over the course of the last few weeks I detected a clear political bent to some of the small comments Ashley would make.  She doesn't outright support one party or person,  but in a way that's actually worse because what she does do is elevate one party and put down the other one in very passive aggressive ways with small comments here and there,  and opinions added at times.  I don't need someone nefariously sneaking in political views to what should be a mostly non political tip.  I'm not suggesting you can't mention the effects of a new tax proposal but if you go back and listen you will hear very clear partisan comments and opinions being expressed that are absolutely not factual or proven.  Stick to facts and don't present opinion unless you make it clear you are stating an opinion,  which you did not.  I don't appreciate that and frankly we have enough of people slyly expressing opinions under the guise of news and information.  As such, I removed this from my flash briefing.

title: A minute well spent
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2020
content: I listen to ‚ÄúThe One Minute Retirement Tip‚Äù every morning in my Alexa flash-briefing.  I‚Äôm 62 years old, and plan on retiring within the next five years.  I like this podcast, and recommend it to anyone in my situation.  The topics are of course only touched on, and not explored to any great depth or detail, and that‚Äôs a good thing.  A thought provoking overview of the many, many aspects of retirement is all I need.  I‚Äôve been surprised that focus isn‚Äôt always on just money.  The real-life, day to day, human part of retirement is also considered.  The narrator, Ashley Micciche, speaks in a very casual, unscripted manor that I find refreshing, although it‚Äôs a bit of an acquired taste.  Her voice is very youthful, and can seem a little out of place for the serious subject matter.  I looked up her YouTube videos just to see if she wasn‚Äôt a sixteen year old prodigy operating out of her parent‚Äôs basement.  (Turns out, not only is she a highly professional adult business woman, her company caters to business owners and/or people who have a lot more money than I do.)  Overall, ‚ÄúThe One Minute Retirement Tip‚Äù does its job: short, well thought out advice.

title: I've been listening for 6 months now....
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2019
content: If you have not enabled this ap yet, what are you waiting for? Why wouldn't you want to take a minute or two to hear a tip that may add or enhance the information we ALL need to know about retirement. It is something we all will face at some point or another, and it's certainly a factor that I've seen all too often, people are woefully under prepared for, and Ashley is here to help, one tip at a time. She has been generous enough to offer additional support via email and suggestions beyond her daily tips that you can take advantage of or not! It's up to you. If there's a day that the tip is something that you may find does not apply to you, you simply would say, "Alexa, skip" and move on... I have not done that yet! However, my point is.. keep 'em coming Ashley, I do appreciate your daily information, and your positive energy each morning to start my day!

title: Getting Better (No longer a waste of time)
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2019
content: August 2019 - Today was my first opportunity to listen. The presenter did not have any useful information but self promoted herself on other media outlets such as twitter and Facebook.Waste of time for any serious listener seeking real information.February 2020 - This is a follow-up review because Ashley specifically called out my first review "on air" today and said "thank you" for my review, even though it was uncharacteristically negative. Consequently, I felt I owed her a second opportunity for an honest critical review..... I have listened everyday since my original posting in August 2019. I believe Ashley has indeed up'ed the sophistication and usefulness of the information she provides. I appreciate when she speaks of topics not often discussed within the fluffy mainstream. I appreciate her speaking her opinion and then providing her rationale for her opinions. Her recent discourse and warnings about ETF's and market cap versus equal cap is prime example of excellent topical matter I look for in a good Retirement Tip podcast.I believe Ashley is a knowledgeable and skilled professional. I hope she continues to provide real financial protein, not zero cal fluff. Thanks Ashley,  F.B.

title: Highly recommended!!!
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2021
content: I start every day with my collection of flash briefings and Ashley is first on my wake up list.  Her info is essential for being smart with money, retirement and investing.  I love when her Dad is on the show and I always learn something from every topic.I would ask that she skip the forecast of the subject of the week and no subject content that day.  She is such a wealth of knowledge I just know she can find one more tidbit to add to the forecast briefing day..But in the end I would never pull her show from my lineup..HIGHLY RECOMENDED!!!!  FOR ANY AGE OF RETIREMENT PLANNING

title: Good way to learn

It's one thing to lose a spouse, but how and what to deal with in what order, etc. I look forward to learning more.  I really enjoy this show, regardless if its 1 minute or 10!  Thanks!

date: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2019
content: I have generally appreciated this but increasingly I find it be repetitive, On Monday I hear what she is going to cover all week with no real content, on Tue....what she is going to cover & how important it is for women to learn about finances on Wed same except she tells me what she will cover on Thur. Thursday a little bit of real info, on Friday how important....and tells me to refer to Thursday.  Not helpful.

title: It's like an "Essential Quick Guide" for Investing and Retirement Planning!
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2019
content: It is pretty remarkable how much valuable information Ashley manages to share in a brief 1,2,3 minutes.  She is clearly very knowledgeable and extremely passionate about her work.  You can tell how much she enjoys helping her clients, too. Her book recommendations continue to be terrific, which feels like such an added bonus. Often times, I find myself getting the books she recommends. Lastly, she has a keen understanding of investing across generations, so her tips typically include the nuance for various ages and stages of life/investing, broadening her audience and the number of people she can tangibly support. She is all around impressive!  I am a big fan.

title: Not helpful.
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2018
content: The title and description is a bit misleading. It baselessly tells you to use a machine learning algorithm, and sometimes even says a certain machine learning algorithm is "better" than another. Such algorithms are all different and have their own specific use cases, so comparing them in this way is misleading.I am surprised this skill made it past certification. Say "Alexa, open Machine Learning Recommender" to see what I mean. It says a statement, not sounding anything like a prompt or question, and then waits for input. Most of the time, skills that do this fail to pass certification.

  ¬†ActiveCore via Alexa is a pretty novel idea. I can undoubtedly see that this initial integration is only the beginning for this young platform from Comcast Business. The app is a tad sluggish when getting the data, but once it grabs the information about your network, the update via Alexa is clear and easy to understand. I started to check the status using the ActiveCore app on my iPhone while attending my daughter's violin practice, but ran out of time. As practice ended and when leaving the venue, I asked Alexa how my ActiveCore network was looking and I got a great readout while I was walking to my car! I imagine things will only get more robust and become an even better experience with time.

title: Easy access to financial advice for millennial parents
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2022
content: Kevin Mahoney's podcast Financially Well is full of tips for millennials who want to start a family or already have one. I like how this content is niche and direct. This skill makes it easy to be notified of the latest podcast episode and request the episode hands-free. I also like that I can find out more about Kevin's background and his approach to financial advice by saying "Alexa, ask Financially Well to tell me about Kevin." Kevin is a CFP and has a friendly approachable style.

skillname: Financially Well by Kevin Mahoney, CFP¬Æ
title: A great example of how good financial advice is becoming more accessible
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2022
content: If you‚Äôre not a Millennial, Kevin‚Äôs financial insights probably won‚Äôt appeal to you. But if you‚Äôre between the ages of 25-45 or so, Financially Well is great. It‚Äôs concise, relevant, and (somewhat amazingly) full of empathy. Millennial parents, in particular, will be so much better off ‚Äî including emotionally and psychologically ‚Äî after accessing this skill and/or listening to the full podcast.

skillname: Financially Well by Kevin Mahoney, CFP¬Æ
title: Perfect Podcast for Millenial Parents
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2022
content: The Financially Well Podcast is exactly what I was looking for as a Millenial Parent. I most often listen to podcasts while I'm on the go, and these succinct and well researched episodes allow me to gain real valuable insight into financial matters that are important to me without having to block off time specifically for this task. I can listen to an episode while I'm on the way to pick up my son from pre-school, easily get through it, and come away with information that is actionable and easily to implement in my own life.

date: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2020
content: Useful and quick tips about investing and money management. There are also interesting psychology topics such as investor biases. I like the mix of psychology and pragmatic information. For example, financial advice about avoiding taxes and saving for retirement - information we can all use.I find the hosts' voices calming and down to earth, whether it's Helen, Olivia, Candace, or anyone else from the team. You can tell they really care about helping people manage their money.If I ever miss the Alexa briefing or want to replay what I heard, I also listen to past episodes on the podcast on Spotify or Apple Podcasts / other apps available too. (The podcast has the same name as the briefing, just search for it.) Highly recommend!

title: For Town and Country... and privacy risk
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2021
content: In 2019 Amazon's Brian Huseman, Vice President of Public Policy responded to a letter from U.S. Senator Chris Coons (D-Del.) which asked " (1.b) Do users have the ability to delete any or all of these [Alexa] transcripts?"Amazon: "...we may still retain other records of customers‚Äô Alexa interactions, including records of actions Alexa took in response to the customer‚Äôs request. And when a customer interacts with an Alexa skill, that skill developer may also retain records of the interaction."Senator Coons: " (1.c) Are there any transcripts that a user cannot delete? If so, why is a user permitted to delete voice recordings but not the corresponding text transcript?"Amazon: "Please see the answer to 1(b)."Senator Coons: (2.) Does Amazon preserve, either in audio or textual form, the Alexa system‚Äôs responses to user questions? If so, is a user able to delete the audio or the transcript of such a response?Amazon: "Please see the answer to 1(b)."

title: Real talk about building an agency
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 6, 2019
content: Refreshingly honest take from an ad/marketing agency. A sample episode I just heard is about why the team lost a client and what they would do differently to avoid it next time. Erik made a strong healthy statement that I liked: he won‚Äôt take on clients for less than six months, and he explained why. It's okay - it's healthy - for marketers to be picky about clients.Overall, can‚Äôt emphasize enough that I appreciate the transparency. When so much of the advertising and marketing world contains posturing and display cases of award trophies, it‚Äôs helpful to talk about what went wrong, too.Good content for anyone building up a marketing or similar consulting practice. Erik puts thought and effort into this show. Some episodes might be longer than a minute or two, as it‚Äôs also a podcast, but give this briefing a listen if you want to hear real talk about building an agency.P.S. I like the sonic branding (e.g. the intro music). Nothing cheesy. Good quality audio: easy to listen to.

title: Call Patrick if you're looking in Pebble Beach or Carmel
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2019
content: We are looking for a home in Carmel or Pebble Beach, and we have a lot of (sometimes conflicting) constraints. title: Not a bad skill, but access pin is readable by anyone, even months after the fact.
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2017
content: The skill itself isn't bad--in fact I used it for a couple months without issue. My concern is that the pin code necessary to access account information, pay bills, etc is stored as plain text in Alexa's voice history list, and can be read by anyone who looks. 99% of people are not going to know how to go on Amazon through their PC and clear that history, or scroll through hundreds of entries and delete it from the Alexa app. This to me pretty much negates the security aspect of requiring a pin, and so I removed the skill.

I would like to see this fixed to allow a payment to be made when there is a balance on the card, even if there is no minimum amount due.

Right now is just says "Checking ####" or "Savings ####".  When you have more than one of an account type, it is impossible to know which account is which and using the online nicknames I have set would be great!2) Ability to show/hide certain accounts (this goes for online as well as the Alexa skill). The second time, even though we troubleshooted with the level 1 support and it was determined to be a back end issue, the digital team closed out my issue with a standard response to "call amazon".  Very frustrating.  I chose this bank because they appeared so tech savvy.  Clearly they are not.

title: A man who loves to help others based on his own amazing history

content: Dave is a fascinating person who loves to help others realize their dreams. His story is a truly amazing one and he uses his experiences to cut through the clutter to "declassify" the methods to making your own success a reality. Highly recommended!

date: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2018
content: Dave not only gives amazing content, he's a great guy. To me, it matters when you are a man of character. Dave's honesty and integrity are very apparent in these daily briefs. Declassified is worth the time.

title: Quick Easy Updates About Digital Assets & Crypto
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2021
content: I'm interested in digital assets and cryptocurrency so I was keen to hear updates from Tyrone Ross (seen him on CNBC and YouTube and seems like he's on it) and his Onramp team. I might be wrong, but like I said seems like they are pretty strong or at least credible in the space.Anyway, like how quick and easy it is for me to see the notification on my Echo that there's an update. Then I just ask for it and there it is. Plus the updates are quick (seems to average around thirty seconds or so).This might be important to some (not so much me but kinda nice). The skill also lets you ask about the company, the founders, see their pix and hear them read their own bios. Like I said, not really that important to me, but kinda cool and a nice way to learn more, and hands-free (that I dig).  I listened while brushing my teeth. For me, that's better than staring, yet even more, at my laptop screen :-)  Pow!

title: Hands-free updates from cryptocurrency experts

title: BECOME SMARTER AND BRIGHTER IN 5-MINUTE SOUND BITES
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2018
content: Make Me Smart is among my top listens among podcasts, never miss it, so it's cool to have a tidbit on demand from Alexa. After work I have my Jake Tapper fix, Tech Ride Home, and my Today Explained fix and now I can add Make Me Smart to the mix. Kai and Molly mix today's topical interests with expertise from the authorities and academics who know deeply and manage mostly economic issues and they make us all smarter while kidding each other about music and fear of dancing, avocado toast and some brilliant, funny T-shirt ideas. They've got a delicious recipe for content and presentation. Try the skill! thanks, Kai and Molly!

title: Little nuggets of smart
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2018
content: This skill offers short "explainers" on various topics that show up in the news or contemporary discussion, such as the economics of the World Cup, what is 5G mobile service, etc. (The idea for this is derived from -- a spinoff, if you will -- the "Make Me Smart" podcast, which is my goes-to-#1-in-the-queue podcast download every week.) Under five minutes, plain language, painless and interesting. Highly recommended.

title: Exciting First Step
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2018
content: I really like the innovative approach to sharing MMS content.  I downloaded yesterday and tried it out.  The content that I sampled was redundant with what I've heard on the pod cast.  This might be better for someone less obsessed with listening every week.  On the other hand, perhaps this would be a great place to deploy content that supplements the pod cast.  In which case, Molly and Kai could promote that there are gems (extended interviews, etc) available on the Echo.  Technically, the app got stuck in a loop and would only accept one of the other subject areas.  To get out of the loop, I finally shut the echo down.  I think there needs to be a better way to say goodbye for now.

title: Huh. So that‚Äôs how you spell ‚ÄòMolly Wood‚Äô...
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2018
content: I‚Äôve actually been wondering. Well, yah know, ‚ÄòKai Ryssdal‚Äô is so obvious I just couldnt help it. üôÉOK, *serious üßê face* for a sec. I see tremendous potential for Alexa as a user interface for collecting listener feedback. For the focus-challenged, mental-landscape wandering, MMS-wavelength oriented regular like me, Alexa is a means for collecting succinct, directed, scope-defined responses in near real time and conveniently in podcast-friendly audio format. Perhaps this isnt a widespread problem with the MMS audience at large, but I personally struggle to provide feedback despite frequently having the strong desire to do so, because I simply have too much I‚Äôm inspired to say. If i were to write an email response, I would have trouble keeping it at sub-Tolstoyian lengths. Though well-intentioned, it would be a challenge to integrate into podcast format and may not make it back to yall before relevence has diminished in the wake of the latest outrage or executive faux pas . But interfacing via the echo, I can easily capture and send my feedback as my response arises to my mind while taking advantage of fast, integrated voice commands to execute.  I suspect there will be an efficiency gain back at the studio, too, since the various commands that can be assigned to trigger recording can also be used to triage the incoming responses.I really hope to see this aspect expand to include more Alexa skills/commansthemes like block chain, meta-data & data rights (I have so much to say on that, Molly. So much. And pre-Cambridge Analytica, I was a very lonely warrior...lol). And of course, to collect responses to the MMS signature question, so brilliantly designed to induce individual self-reflection while facilitating empathic bonding (both soft skills badly needed in these times of growing ideological division).Bottom line: I cant wait to try it out! Also, you guys rock!! So much! Thanks for being people i like to like, and who like what i like, and who make the world a better place by advocating positive and intelligent cohesion üòá!

title: Keep up with tech and business
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2018

title: Usually very accurate
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2020
content: While I think this is a great feature, today the topic was "homeschooling" and Molly claimed that due to Covid-19 everyone is homeschooling.  WRONG.  Homeschooling is not the same as Online School.Online school is attending a school, ONLINE, which is what most students are doing during the current crisis.  They are still enrolled in a public or private school and access the curriculum virtually.Homeschooling is when a student doesn't attend a school (is not enrolled in a public school), but is educated at home, by the parents or a group of parents/people.I hope they have a correction on this as its a BIG DIFFERENCE between the two.

title: Keep to the facts
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2021
content: For the most part I really like MMS.  It is fun, informative, and most are fact filled; but some are rubbish and politicized.  Particularly "Founding Fathers" was sadly misinformed as most founding fathers of this country were not super wealthy and did either plan to or make every effort to see slavery eliminated. Three did not own any slaves at all.  Molly's report on the Founding Fathers make them look like a bunch of wealthy, white men only in it for the money aka the 1619 project.  This was a time in history when they knew if they insisted upon immediately eliminating slavery there would be no USA.  Stick to the facts or don't report on it at all.

title: The 10 stocks recommended in their 2020 report for 2021 were down 94%
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2021
content: They recommended these  10 stocks in their report of what to invest for 2021.  Here are the stocks and their 1 year returns:APPN - down 52%, NET, up 80.5%, FVRR, down 41%, FLGT, up 71%, LMND, down 62%, MELI, down 18%, OKTA, down 9%; PINS, down 44%, SHOP, up 28.5, and ZM, down 2.1%.  If you had invested equal dollars in these 10 at the start of 2021,  you would have had a 94% loss.  However,  to be fair to Motley Fool, they recommend buying 25 stocks and holding for 5 years.  So maybe the 2021 losers will be winners in the long run.

title: Motley Fool Member to many services
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2019
content: I don't care what some people say, Alexa can't understand some of the company names.  For instance when I wanted to know the current price of "The Trade Desk" which you would think would be easy to understand but she just doesn't.  EVEN THOUGH SHE HAS THE TRADE DESK ON  MY WATCH LIST! AND SHE PRONOUNCES IT PERFECTLY WHEN IT HAPPENS TO BE THE BIGGEST WINNER OR LOSER IN MY PORTFOLIO.  It is very frustrating because I don't have problems with communicating with Alexa for anything else. Also I had added stocks that I didn't want because she misunderstood me.  I don't know of a way to get her to list the stocks on my watch list. Like many people have been saying their needs to be a way to edit your watch list so that you can correct the app.  It is very hard to keep control because she misunderstands you and could add/subtract stocks on you watch list.  I have stopped using the app.  I really don't need to know the daily fluctuations.  But it was fun while it lasted.  I used it for about a year.

title: Jen has her finger on the pulse!
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2019
content: I listen to Jen Lehner's flash briefing every morning as I settle in at my desk and organize my thoughts (I'm an author, social media strategist, and online community-builder). There's always some useful nugget about the world of social media and entrepreneurship that's timely and useful. I love the way Jen mixes things up by sometimes including segments like mini-interviews with other entrepreneurs (the business book suggestions have been great) and it's always good to know what's coming up in terms of 'special' days. Make Your Bed Day? Who knew?With her cheerful, easy-going demeanor,  Jen is a pleasure to listen to - she sets a light, positive tone for the rest of my day! My only teeny tiny beef is the briefing only arrives Monday-Friday and though I know it's not ideal from a work-life balance perspective, I often work on weekends. When I find myself at my desk on a Saturday morning I can't help but wonder, "Where's Jen?" So, yeah - I'm a fan-girl! Keep up the great work, Jen!

date: Reviewed in the United States on June 16, 2020
content: I love catching the Front Row as part of my daily Alexa flash briefing and I get so much value from it that I've swapped the order in which it plays so that I hear this one first!¬†¬†A lot of other reviewers have covered Jen's timely content so I'll share how to change the order of your flash briefing so you can hear the Front Row first.¬†Open the Alexa app > Menu > Settings > scroll to "Flash Briefing" > Tap "Edit" on top right > Drag and drop your flash briefings to change the order in which they play.

skillname: Ryan Smith - Knoxville and Maryville Real Estate
title: Excellent Realtor!
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 17, 2022
content: This is the third property Ryan has handled for us. The first one was a very small piece of property, for very little money, but lots of questions! Ryan handled that tiny transaction as if it was a million dollar property. Good old fashioned customer service, honesty & hard work. Hard to find these days. When it came to selling our ‚Äòmillion dollar view‚Äô property and to downsize. Ryan was the only realtor I considered. I have bought and sold many properties in my lifetime. Ryan is the true professional. He‚Äôs proactive, providing all the info up front, unless a buyer & their realtor can‚Äôt read, all the info (accurate info) is provided WITH the listing. Preventing any confusion. He holds the other ‚Äòside‚Äô accountable and believes everyone needs to abide by the agreed upon ‚Äòcontract‚Äô. Therefore eliminating a lot of issues. If there are issues, he handles them, and sometimes tells you later‚Ä¶. Eliminating a lot if the stress. Ryan is the ONLY realtor I feel extremely comfortable recommending 100%. Don‚Äôt get me wrong, there are a lot of very nice realtors out there, but if you want a friend, hire them. If you want to make a friend AND the job gets done proficiently, on time, without surprises ‚Ä¶.. hire Ryan! He‚Äôs done an excellent job selling me property, listing and selling my property, then helping me close a deal on our downsize. Thanks Ryan!!

title: The best real estate agent around!
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2019
content: As first time home buyers, my husband and I had little understanding of the process that was involved in buying a home. He was always available to us either through email, text or phone and was extremely prompt in response time in getting back to us if he wasn‚Äôt available immediately. He would take time on the weekends, and evenings to show us homes when it was convenient for US even though I know this HAD to interfere with his time off.Ryan is an extremely personable individual who is so easy to talk to and by the end of the whole process, I felt as if we had known each other forever. If you are in the market to buy a home from someone who is charming, well-informed, diligent in wanting to find you the perfect home  and willing to do what it takes to get the job done without a hitch, Ryan is the man for you!Thanks Ryan for all your hard work!! We REALLY couldn‚Äôt have done it without you and I am so ecstatic that I got the chance to meet and work with you. We couldn‚Äôt have asked for a better person to help us in buying the perfect home!Sincerely,Kathie & Stephen Hall

skillname: Ryan Smith - Knoxville and Maryville Real Estate
title: Looking for a amazing realtor!
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2021
content: Our family survived a big move, but I don‚Äôt think we would have made it through the process without Ryan! The first time we met Ryan was 2 to 3 years ago to purchase a vacant lot beside our home. At that time, he made the process so easy and smooth. So, when we decided to list our house back in February we knew exactly who to call. We immediately called him to setup a meeting to see what to do to get our house listed. Everything had to line up perfectly for this to happen! We had to list our house that we were living in, and also list the lot that we had previously purchased. However, the catch was that we would not let the lot go unless the house was sold also! Well, it all happened just like it needed to. Ryan provided much needed guidance throughout the complete process. Not only that, but anytime we requested to go see a home that was listed he always did his best to make it happen and always adapted to our crazy schedules. Even though selling a home can be so stressful, Ryan made it easy and always there to help. Our family enjoyed the times of laughing our way through the process with Ryan and getting to know him. If we should ever need to move again Ryan will be our go to!Kelly
